question: 椅子
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>chair</kanji> <kanji>child</kanji> is for some reason just a <vocabulary>chair</vocabulary>. Not sure why it's a child, but it is.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for <ja>子</ja> is weird. It's <ja>す</ja>, so think about how you sat on this chair and it broke, so you <reading>sue</reading>d (<ja>す</ja>) the person who made the chair (who happened to be a child).
